actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend the Education Amendments of 1972 to exempt certain youth organizations, college fraternities, and sororities, and intercollegiate sports from provisions requiring that admissions and benefits be allocated without regard to gender.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Exempts from the prohibitions against sex discrimination of the Education Amendments of 1972, nonprofit youth organizations and nonprofit social or honorary fraternal and sororal organizations which traditionally admitted only persons of one sex, and intercollegiate athletic activities. Provides that this Act shall be effective as of June 23, 1972, as though it had been part of the Education Amendments of 1972 as originally passed.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Education Amendments of 1972 to exempt certain youth organizations, college fraternities, and sororities, and intercollegiate sports from provisions requiring that admissions and benefits be allocated without regard to gender.
